lead: This week in tech highlights major investments in AI, innovative product launches, and exciting developments in the Australian tech ecosystem.

stories.title: Sapiom raises $15M to help AI agents buy their own tech tools
stories.summary: Sapiom, a startup focused on enabling AI agents to make autonomous technology purchases, has secured $15 million in funding from Accel. This financial layer aims to streamline the authentication and micro-payment processes for AI agents, marking a significant step in the evolution of AI autonomy in tech procurement.

stories.title: Amazon can't build AI capacity fast enough, throws another $200B at the problem
stories.summary: Amazon is ramping up its investment in AI, committing an additional $200 billion to enhance its capabilities. This move comes as the demand for AI solutions continues to surge, highlighting the competitive landscape among tech giants to secure a leading position in AI development.

stories.title: Reddit looks to AI search as its next big opportunity
stories.summary: Reddit is exploring the integration of AI into its search functionalities, aiming to merge traditional search with AI capabilities. During its recent earnings call, the company emphasized the potential of AI search as a significant market opportunity, despite not yet monetizing it.

stories.title: HBO is turning Baldur’s Gate into a TV show
stories.summary: HBO is set to adapt the popular RPG Baldur's Gate 3 into a television series, with Craig Mazin as the showrunner. The adaptation will introduce new characters while incorporating existing ones from the game, promising to expand the narrative universe of the beloved franchise.

stories.title: AWS revenue continues to soar as cloud demand remains high
stories.summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) reported its highest revenue growth in over three years, driven by increasing demand for cloud services and AI integration. This growth underscores the pivotal role of cloud technology in supporting modern digital infrastructure and AI advancements.

stories.title: X's latest Community Notes experiment allows AI to write the first draft
stories.summary: X is testing a new feature in its Community Notes that allows AI to draft initial notes, which can then be refined by community feedback. This initiative aims to enhance the efficiency of content creation on the platform, showcasing a novel application of AI in social media.

stories.title: Podcast: Brian Collins, Tasmania’s new startup champion, Australian VC funding, Musk & the Epstein files
stories.summary: In this episode, Brian Collins discusses the vibrant startup scene in Tasmania and the landscape of Australian venture capital funding. The podcast highlights the challenges and opportunities for local startups, providing insights into the region's tech ecosystem.

stories.title: AI companies want you to stop chatting with bots and start managing them
stories.summary: Emerging AI companies are shifting focus from user interaction with chatbots to the management of AI agents. This trend indicates a maturation in AI technology, where users are expected to oversee AI operations rather than merely engage with them.

stories.title: Starlink Is Using Your Personal Data to Train AI. Here’s How to Opt Out
stories.summary: Starlink has updated its privacy policy to include the use of personal data for training AI tools. Users are provided with options to opt out, raising important discussions about data privacy and the ethical implications of AI development.

stories.title: Amazon and Google are winning the AI capex race — but what’s the prize?
stories.summary: Amazon and Google are leading the capital expenditure race in AI, with Amazon planning to invest $200 billion and Google not far behind. This competition highlights the strategic importance of AI technology in shaping the future of their respective business models.
